name: UpdateIncident
description:
Partially update an incident's details.

Use this tool to update specific attributes of an existing incident in Datadog. Only the provided attributes will be modified.

parameters.name: incident_uuid
parameters.description: The unique identifier (UUID) for the incident to be updated.

parameters.name: incident_payload
parameters.description: JSON object containing the attributes and relationships to update an incident in Datadog, such as timestamps, impact details, and user relationships.

customer_impact_end.description: Timestamp when customers were no longer impacted by the incident.

customer_impact_scope.description: A summary of the impact customers experienced during the incident.

customer_impact_start.description: Timestamp when customers began being impacted by the incident.

customer_impacted.description: A flag indicating whether the incident caused customer impact.

detected.description: Timestamp when the incident was detected.

fields.description: A condensed view of the user-defined fields for which to update selections.

display_name.description: The name of the notified handle.

handle.description: The handle used for the notification. This includes an email address, Slack channel, or workflow.

notification_handles.description: Notification handles that will be notified of the incident during update.

title.description: The title of the incident, which summarizes what happened.

attributes.description: The incident's attributes for an update request.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the user.
A unique identifier that represents the integration metadata.

integrations.description: A relationship reference for multiple integration metadata objects.

id.description: A unique identifier that represents the postmortem.

relationships.description: The incident's relationships for an update request.

data.description: Incident data for an update request.

parameters.name: include_related_objects
parameters.description: List of related object types to include in the response, such as 'users', 'comments', etc.

value_schema.description: Specifies which types of related objects should be included in the response.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Datadog API.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Specifies which types of related objects should be included in the response.

value_schema.description: Specifies which types of related objects should be included in the response.

customer_impact_scope.description: A summary of the impact customers experienced during the incident.

customer_impact_start.description: Timestamp when customers began being impacted by the incident.

detected.description: Timestamp when the incident was detected.

handle.description: The handle used for the notification. This includes an email address, Slack channel, or workflow.
